storyInfo: Hatred drives Thiago to take vengeance on the Inquisition. Hatred blinds Gladiia to the opportunity in front of her, and she parts ways with Ulpianus. However, beneath their hatred is a burning desire to protect one's home, and duty.

attributes.content: It's here.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (He led me here, and then covered his scent. Seems he's learned a handful of tricks from his time on land.)
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia looks all around her.
She knows that someone once considered a friend is watching her closely.
But she does not hesitate, nor does she have the luxury to hesitate. She must retrieve the secrets of this ship as quickly as possible, and... return them to Ægir.
She wishes to return to her home. She wishes to offer it her aid, to avert calamity.
She looks at the key in her hands.
She swings open the door to the treasury.
Burning away all the nethersea brand is no small feat. I really ought to thank Kal'tsit and that jet-black creature of hers.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The nethersea brand was unable to devour this reef. How unfortunate.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Yet this is but one of myriad forms. You have not heard the prophecy, so you would not understand.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Prophecy? Do you think yourselves more than a band of refugees clinging to unknown lifeforms? What sort of future did you expect?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Our prophet is nothing like you. She never paints images of a false future, nor does she make promises she cannot fulfill.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: She spoke thusly: that countless massive scales shall merge into one and fly into the vast expanse. That the ocean will be smeared with light, forever growing, never drying up.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: That life and death will disappear and merge into a single entity. And at that time, even the false cosmos will be unable to eclipse the light of life.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: We shall all live in that ecosystem. We are all part of its magnificent Cycle. Life is born, is given purpose, seeks worth, and disappears. Only for the cycle to begin anew.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Sounds a whole lot like the sort of elaborate hallucination that can be cooked up by Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Is pushing Iberia to its current precipice, and slaughtering millions of lives, also part of your magnificent Cycle?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: What do you possibly know?! Our kind does not consider the death of an individual to be an 'end.' Even when a life ends, it remains part of the Cycle!
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: You are angry, you are restless, and above all you are only human, heretic.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...You won't take me alive, Inquisitor. I know all about your heinous Originium Arts. We're all prepared to make the greater sacrifice.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Our prophet will remain as out of reach to you as time itself slipping through your fingertips.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: High Inquisitor! Everyone in Gran Faro has long held a grudge against you people! The Penal Battalion cannot approach this place, and you are alone!
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: There's nowhere for you to run!
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: ...Run?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Did you think we came here to entertain your sophistry about good and evil?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: He's not saying anything. This Iberian's a damn imbecile.
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: That black monster must have some kind of weakness. It's extremely durable, and can burn the nethersea brand with ease. What the hell is that thing?!
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: If you don't tell us, then by the time the Penal Battalion breaks free, we'll have already—
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: —Lost?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Haha... You can't even handle Dr. Kal'tsit and the Inquisitor. Admit it, you've already lost.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Shut up!
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: I'm gonna make you— Wait, what are you doing?!
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: Why's your staff moving around?! What did you do?
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: Guess you spent so much time researching tentacle monsters that you forgot what Originium Arts are?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Seriously, get your head outta the clouds—
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Guh—
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You self-righteous bastard—! You think we haven't made ample preparations? Do you have any idea how long we've waited to flush out all of you scum colluding with the Inquisition?
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: Don't fall for his tricks. He's been hiding in this town for months now. Definitely a spy, and one well-versed in communications to boot.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: There's a chance our position has already been compromised.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Spies, spies! Of course the Inquisition's spies have been lurking among us since long ago!
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: I knew about you people because you never tried to hide it, and Amaia and I are close. But the Inquisition is different. They already don't like us, and if they wanted to hide...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: How would we ever know? After all, we've been nothing but laborers for generations.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Throw him out then, and feed him to our kin. The nethersea brand's growth is slowing down, and we need more nutrients to stop the Penal Battalion.
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: We should also find an escape route.
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: Alright. I'll lead the way. Nobody's more familiar with this town than me, and we've left behind plenty of secret passages and underground depots.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You shouldn't be doing this, Thiago.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: How long have we known each other? And now you're gonna preach to me, you platitude-spewing zealot?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Stand up and walk. Time to become a part of the sea.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: (I see.)
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (A union of Originium and Ægir technology, a sturdier dome, the use of modules from nomadic cities on land, and the scalability of Originium Arts.)
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (So this is how the genius of the Academy of Sciences viewed this land. And he managed to accomplish all this decades ago.)
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (However...)
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: However, it's still not enough.
Ægir would be able to accomplish all this even without making contact with land. The integration of certain technologies cannot make the difference between victory and defeat.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I knew it... It's you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I wish it weren't, though, Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Stay back. Take another step and I'll run you through, my old comrade-in-arms.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Skadi once thought herself the last of the Abyssal Hunters. Even she had thought you dead. Yet here you are.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How insightful of you, Consul Gladiia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The circumstances don't seem to call for pomp and ceremony, Consul Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Feeling a bit nostalgic over titles long disused, are we?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We've known each other long enough. You should know very well what it means when a Hunter doesn't return.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I've executed no fewer than you. And I can assure you that if any survivors have sunken into the abyss, I'd still hang them up to bake on the reefs before they ever got a chance to hear that song.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: What about now? You reek of their scent. You've become one of them.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Don't lie to yourself, Gladiia. You are strict with others, but even more so with yourself.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Has wandering the land sufficiently satisfied your desire to torment yourself?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Hunter, I WILL kill you if your answer doesn't satisfy me.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia, most of this situation is largely out of your hands. I'm forced to approach the problem from a different angle.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: What situation?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I... Like you, I have spent some time on land.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But what I saw was different. Did you come to understand the civilizations on land? No, you don't need to answer that, Gladiia the ever-arrogant.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: For their civilizations to survive, they tapped into Originium. It brought them opportunity and hope, but it also unprecedented calamity. To this day, they still have not fully analyzed its principles.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I've witnessed many tragedies... They've given them the name 'Catastrophes.' They are foolish, ignorant, and weak, but the way they struggle and die is still harrowing.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: And the Ægir... are no different.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You were never this sentimental in the past.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No, sentiment has nothing to do with this.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: What I'm saying is, Ægir provoked the ocean in order to survive, and the ocean devoured it in return. Then, ocean gave birth to us.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: We are products of a grotesque struggle. If we are unable to resolve this problem at its root, then we are unable to resolve it at all.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...What did you see, Ulpianus? What did you see to make you abandon the bonds of blood and the camaraderie we shared in battle?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: 'Sanctuary.' No doubt that is what those filthy cultists would've called it.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Your familiarity with them only reduces my trust in you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But the word is an apt description.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You know what Ægir once found in the depths of the ocean. Even if aren't a historian, a general education should've covered at least this.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Thousands of years ago, we reached the heart of the ocean. There, we found the point of origin. The cradle of civilization.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: As far as I know, Gladiia...
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: He, and those Seaborn, in the deepest recesses of their nest...
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I saw it. A 'construct.' No, not even the greatest science consuls of Ægir would have been able to make sense of what I saw.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I was unable to go deeper, as my injuries were too severe. My blood boiled, my ears rang, but still I felt—
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: —The plurality of Him.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Well... That doesn't even slightly explain why you abandoned the team. You should have brought this information back.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: When millions of cries returned to a single point, the unhatched Seaborn all murmured the same name from within their differently-shaped sacs.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...Ishar-mla.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Or rather, Skadi.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Did it escape into the sea?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: No matter. It will return. And we'll continue to wait.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Ugh. Whoever decided that we were its 'kin'? Pathetic.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Mm. I see it too. The waves breaking unnaturally, like a twister. Or a mirage of an ocean city. What a strange sight.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Pah. It sure was lively today. Haven't had this much commotion since young Jamie and the chef died.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...Nnh.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Pomegranate... flower.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: ...Knight.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I wasn't expecting to see you back so soon. Did you come rushing to my ship because you missed the scent of your hometown? Have you gone completely mad yet?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The knight simply stares at Alfonso in silence.

But almost immediately, his sight fixates once again upon the ocean. Alfonso follows his gaze, and through the years in which time itself has become nebulous, day and night have already lost all meaning.
Are you still hunting the terrible waves?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I sure hope the blood of these monsters hasn't made you immortal. You can look forward to drowning one day. What a joyous thing.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Not a whole lot of wind today.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...Waves, are the ocean's, breath.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: It still has not, stopped breathing.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: It has not, died.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Just like, the monsters, on land. They devour, destroy.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: The monsters on land.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Civilization!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Skadi.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I just remembered something else. How... did we manage to survive?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: How did YOU survive?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I can't remember the details. We hacked and we slashed, again and again without pause, until finally He...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Uh, what I meant was, if they really wanted us dead back then, would we have been able to survive?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Let me put it another way. Ægir doesn't know we're alive either.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: They have no way of knowing.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Was it Swordfish who said she wanted to come to this ship?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Yes. She said this ship could bring us home.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Mm, this does to be Ægir craftsmanship, though the shipwright, Breogan... The name doesn't ring a bell.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...You never did remember the scientists' names.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Do you?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...It's such a relief, even talking to you like this.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Are you back for good, Laurentina? You won't leave us again, will you?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Haha, do you have to be so cheesy about it? I've also been with you, things just got a bit blurry in the middle there. Plus, it's kinda fun playing the part of a well-behaved nun.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Oh, but the captain had this outfit specially made for me by our friends over at Rhodes Island. She already knew my measurements even!
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...To be honest, you grew a bit taller.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Wait, how do YOU know that?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I... I was only helping out. The Captain said she didn't trust the tastes of the landwalkers.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Tastes? Ahaha...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: We both know that's the last thing she cares about. Though, at least I can appreciate how she always makes sure these details are in place.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: She said you like long dresses, and I did always have that impression. But... I rarely do these... tailoring activities.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Ah, these symbols, they're Ægirian letters. We wrote them together.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: They talk about you, about Gladiia, about me. About Ægir... our home.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Whose idea was this? Couldn't have been mine, right?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: We all came up with it together.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What about the style?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Swordfish picked it.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: How unlike her.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: We have to dedicate ourselves to battle.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Sure, sure, but no reason I can't doll myself up before the hunt, right?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Skadi, do you know what the first thought was, when I emerged from my stupor and remembered who I am?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It was to re-examine myself, to see how different I was from that clear, but distant, memory of myself on the other side of the shore.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Though I was dressed as a good little nun last time, I didn't particularly mind—
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: But now that my trusty companions have chosen my outfit for me, that makes me even happier. Can you understand how I feel?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Mm... Definitely better than when you woke up in a jar in Sal Viento.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Haha, that's for sure.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: So, that's why we're going to win over Mister Captain right now, yes?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Leave it to me.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No, impossible...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ishar-mla.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: When I sank into the trench along with the titan's corpse, enduring a pressure that no ordinary Ægir could bear, I saw something I'd never seen before.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Gladiia, you know why Ægir distances itself from the land. You know the many theorems as to why Originium and Catastrophes cannot invade us.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Most of them have been proven correct. The ocean is like a petri dish, nourishing and protecting the purity of Ægir.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But... what if the civilization we're so proud of is nothing more than mold growing on the back of some giant?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You were always exceptionally inquisitive, a quality that allowed you to make contributions in various fields, sowing the seeds for great breakthroughs. But to slander Ægir? You've changed so much I hardly recognize you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Plus, you should know the boundaries of what is appropriate. Your speculation about Skadi... You levy the cruelest of accusations against your fellow Hunter.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: 'Seaborn' is just a broad, catch-all name. As you know, their morphology is significantly more complex.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You've been concerned that Skadi might become an even higher form of them, have you not?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: First and foremost, I'm concerned that you've chosen the wrong path.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The 1st Company and the 4th Company perished along the way, one after the other, to create an opportunity for us to break through.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: And you, the 2nd Company, stayed near the nest's entrance. It seems wrong to even describe it as a 'nest.' We'd entered a vast, singular entity, where we nothing more than tiny germs.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But germs are more than capable of killing a healthy person.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: And we were successful, or so we led ourselves to believe.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I simply fell into a deep sleep, along with His corpse. Blood, if that luminous substance can even be called that, had drenched my whole body and enveloped me.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But I simply slumbered with His corpse for a long, long time. I hid in the crevasses of His empty shell, leaning against the remnants of His flesh, until all sounds around me fell silent.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But what about Skadi? It was she who dealt the final blow.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: That was not a normal 'killing.' Nor was it a 'hunt.' It was 'feeding,' a feeding of their kind.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Your conjecture is both correct and faulty. Did you assume that all Hunters will eventually lose control and become Seaborn? No, not Skadi.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You already understand. Those who've witnessed Him, those of us who sank into the trench and floated back up, all understand.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You mean to say that...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: If anything goes wrong, we must kill her.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: She's YOUR Hunter.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You still haven't offered an explanation for your deliberate cover-up and betrayal. And you would have me trust your speculation like this?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I'm not keen on your habit of staying silent. Maybe I'll have to take away your mobility and drag you back to Ægir.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: A pity that one of our consuls might finally fall in battle. Could harm morale.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Let's see you try.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Gladiia. How can you still claim to represent Ægir when you are so distraught about your own transformation?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: This is an opportunity. I don't expect your assistance, or even understanding, but some of us cannot afford to pass up this opportunity.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Only by uncovering the truth do we have a chance at survival.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: And how is that related to what you're doing?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You came for the ship. I came for Breogan.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I've already made a breakthrough. Breogan's evidence corroborates what I've seen. Truly an amazing man. To think he arrived at these same conclusions, in that era, under those conditions.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Those by your side— You already understand that only they are truly valuable. None of the land-dwellers will ever understand. And thus, he died in solitude.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I wouldn't say that nobody understands, but...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: 'But.' For someone as strong and resolute as yourself, how many times have you said 'but'?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: We are colleagues. Together, we were the architects of this war. We should trust in each other more.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: A final word of advice—don't return to Ægir. It is too soon, too dangerous. Too many things we haven't straightened out. Going back now is wasted effort, and you do not know what has become of it.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Remain on land. Should something happen, of course—she IS my Hunter.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I will shoulder the responsibility.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Gladiia wants to say something else.

But when she turns her head, a tremendous cracking sound spreads through every corner of the room. A violent shuddering follows, and the truth filling the table is scattered across the ground, seeming to sear her vision.
'Leviathan.'

Before the chief designers of warfare proposed the Abyssal Hunter plan, before the Abyssal Hunters delved into their nest, Breogan chose a title that the foolish land-dwellers are obsessed with to this day.
He wanted to thoroughly elucidate the nature of calamities. He found the last piece of the puzzle on land.
My... key... The smell of wheat... Homeland? My homeland supports me. My family supports me.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Until I, crush the ocean.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: The two Hunters look at the brooding knight.
Gladiia clenches the key in her hand.
...Then take a look at this monster. Take a good look. He appears human but is not human. Even the ocean's kin reject him.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Day in and day out, he searches for the terrible waves and seeks to quash them. An endless, futile pursuit.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Just like us.
attributes.name: Ulpianus
